title: AR-Based Biomechanical Knee Load Analysis Simulation Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of biomechanics and human anatomy
context.additional_context: AR Simulation Training for Medical Device Professionals: Enhancing Knee Load Analysis Competency via Volleyball Court Visual Elements in Real-World Exercise Scenarios

learning_goals: Enhanced ability to interpret knee moment and patellar tendon load measurement data during three types of jump movements (drop landing, hop jump, spike jump) in AR simulation environments.

Learners compare three biomechanical metrics (joint angles, EMG, gait cycles) from simulated and real-world rehabilitation environments, producing reports analyzing inter-environmental similarity at ≥80% accuracy

Learners can design a draft assessment protocol for a specific clinical scenario (e.g., postoperative patient monitoring) using AR technology (e.g., Microsoft HoloLens) within 3 weeks and revise it based on feedback averaging ≥4 points on a 5-point scale from an expert panel (2 medical professionals, 1 technical expert).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
